addAllowedCountrySpecification(com.googl.Description: Specifies a country whose addresses can be handled by your app. Note that calling this after you have called @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#UserAddressRequest#Builder#build_E@ will cause a runtime exception to be thrown.

build().Description: Builds an instance of UserAddressRequest and returns it.

addAllowedCountrySpecifications(java.uti.Description: Specifies multiple countries whose addresses can be handled by your app. Note that calling this after you have called @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#UserAddressRequest#Builder#build_E@ will cause a runtime exception to be thrown.

ClassDesc: Builder for creating a @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#UserAddressRequest_E@. This class lets your create an instance of UserAddressRequest that specifies a set of countries for restricting the choice of addresses by the user, i.e. the user can only select an address if it's in one of the specified countries. If no countries are specified, then there are no restrictions and the user can select any of their addresses to share with your app.
